EXPERIENCE

Mentor

Puerto Vallarta, Jalisco, Mexico | Nov 2023 – Jan 2025

  • Serve as second author for conferences and publications

Part-time Lecturer

Chiba University, Matsudo City, Chiba Prefecture | Oct 2021 – Present

  • Deliver Landscape and Environmental Science curriculum in English to all undergraduate juniors (required course)
  • Leverage Google Classroom and multimedia tools to drive critical thinking, interaction, and active learning
  • Curate diverse learning materials: books, academic papers, websites, audiobooks, and films

Consultant & Designer (Self-employed)

Greencastle, Matsudo City, Chiba Prefecture | May 2020 – Present

Ethnobotanical Design

  • Create green designs for indoor, outdoor, and rooftop environments
  • Research optimal plant-environment pairings and propagation techniques for native and tropical species
  • Conduct ethnobotanical plant studies for modern applications

Language & Cultural Consulting

  • Edit English academic papers, commercial materials, and technical documents
  • Provide intercultural and linguistic interpretation and voice-over services
  • Lead cultural tours of Japan (and Puerto Vallarta, MX, since 2022)
  • Clients: Chiba University, Parker's (greenery and interior design), and private individuals

Mentor

Kamiyama Green Valley NPO, S6IX Accelerator Program, Kamiyama Village, Tokushima | Feb 2020 – Mar 2020

Ethnobotanical aquaponics units for local revitalization

  • Delivered ethnobotanical knowledge and social research training
  • Designed aquaponics systems for the innovative revitalization project
  • Led public presentations and collaborative teamwork sessions
  • Program halted due to pandemic

Post-Doctoral Researcher

Chiba University, Matsudo City, Chiba Prefecture | Oct 2018 – Sep 2021

  • Authored, submitted, and edited academic literature for personal and faculty publications
  • Edited English handouts, pamphlets, books, promotional materials, and letters for university staff and faculty
  • Supported faculty with campus duties and academic activities
  • Provided translation, interpretation, tour guiding, and logistical support for international conferences and visitors
  • Organized and conducted the English-speaking hour for Japanese and international students

Ethnobotanical Plant Educator & Landscape Designer

Shanghai PI Cultural Exchange, Shanghai, China | Jun 2019 – Aug 2019

  • Taught weekly classes at community centers and libraries on East Asian ethnobotanical plants (students: children and caretakers)
  • Researched Japanese and Chinese differences in ethnobotanical and landscape use, focusing on parks and communities
  • Designed verandas and entranceways featuring ethnobotanical plants, green walls, and aquaponics systems using recycled local resources

Part-time Lecturer, Research Assistant & Teaching Assistant

Chiba University, Matsudo City, Chiba Prefecture | Apr 2016 – Jun 2019

Teaching & Academic Support

  • Lectured master's-level English Presentation Skills course
  • Directed English House Matsudo, a weekly English-speaking hour
  • Delivered one-on-one English lessons to university students and visiting professors
  • Served as T.A. and co-organizer for the JICA Project Management Course (3 years)
  • Edited English handouts, pamphlets, books, promotional materials, and letters for university staff and faculty
  • Recorded voice-over for Chiba University Matsudo Campus promotional video
  • Supported laboratory and student projects across disciplines

Community Engagement

  • Organized and promoted bimonthly jazz music events, community connection events, and skills workshops
  • Performed as M.C. and singer at the annual International Students' Association Holiday Party

Landscape Design, Landscape Planning & Community Development

  • Facilitated Machizukuri (bottom-up community planning) in Matsudo, Izu, and Kambara: interviews, questionnaires, collaboration with local people, schools, and government entities
  • (2017) Documented and mapped botanicals in a traditional Japanese garden in Kambara as part of a team
  • (2015–2020) Identified ethnobotanical plants in Nogiku (Matsudo City) and researched landscape-community integration
  • (2014–2015) Facilitated Machizukuri workshops in Irouzaki; contributed to the final General Plan design; built landscape models; sketched plans; identified ethnobotanical elements; authored an ethnobotanical book for local residents
  • Collaborated on community improvement events: Iwase seminars, translation/interpretation for guest speakers, ethnobotanical education presentations
  • Taught Ethnobotanical Sumi-E (traditional Japanese watercolor) to university students and Matsudo residents
  • Delivered volunteer environmental ethnobotanical education for Matsudo City residents (invited special event)

Part-time University Lecturer & Elementary School Native English Teacher

University Lecturer

  • Designed curriculum, delivered all lessons, and evaluated students for a year-long English program

Elementary School Teacher

Native English Teacher

Teaching

  • Conducted English teaching seminars for Japanese English teachers

English Club Leadership

School Contributions

  • Contributed to the English Teachers' Weekly Meeting: textbook selection, standardized tests, scheduling, and procedural decisions
  • Managed daily student cleaning groups, directing three teams across campus

Key Accomplishments

  • Trained students one-on-one who won 1st Place in prefectural speech contests all three years; some advanced to nationals
  • Blind survey confirmed AP English Class students' enjoyment and unique learning gains

Ph.D. in Environmental Science and Landscape Planning

Title: Integrating Ethnobotany with Psychological Ownership in Order to Improve Social-Ecological Systems

社会生態学的系改善のためのエスノボタニーと心理的所有権の統合に関する研究

Design Projects

2002 - Single Mother Live-Work Building Designs

  • Designer: Self (volunteer position)
  • Issuer: Sustainable Monterey Bay, Santa Cruz, CA
  • Date: July 2002
  • Overview: Designed 4 to 40-unit apartment complexes. Main features: green roofs, cost reduction through prefabricated sections, work-live units, and private social central area

2015 - Irouzaki General Plan

  • Designers: Aiko Kimura, Sofia Maria Penabaz-Wiley, Natsuko Takahashi, Isami Kinoshita
  • Issuer: Minami Izu Local Government
  • Date: February 2015
  • Title: The Final Design of the Irouzaki Jungle Park for the Irouzaki General Plan
  • Main Contributions: Ethnobotanical garden areas; Play Areas; Design Support: all other areas

2016 - Inohana Children's Hospital Green Roof

  • Designers: Sofia M. Penabaz-Wiley, Amonkar Deepika, Jorge Izquierdo, Poh Qiying, Shi Yang
  • Issuer: National University of Singapore and Chiba University Joint Collaborative Design Workshop: Children's Hospital Design
  • Date: February 26, 2016
  • Title: "Landscape as Connectivity"
  • Main Contributions: Ethnobotanical aspects for five senses, universal design interactive garden play, aquaculture, labyrinth, cupola, ecological support systems. Developed most of the wildlife support, the disabled children's universal design playground, and the aquaponics unit. Used recycled water from the AC units to feed into the space for wildlife. Contributed plant selection.

2014 - CCDC 2014 Cross-Cultural Design Collaboration (Iro Park)

  • Designers: Juan C. Gálvez, Lin Bai, Sofia M. Penabaz-Wiley
  • Issuer: Chiba University Cross-Cultural Design Collaboration (CCDC)
  • Date: September 2014
  • Title: Group 3, "Iro Park"
  • Main Contributions: Water element, herb garden for children's play, cupola, labyrinth, shape, and location inside the park, a half-moon of cherry trees nearby, and UD benches throughout the park. Created an area in the park for children to play in water, art created by a local artist, a shade space for mothers, and native and herbal plants for pollinators as well as for children to learn. Has signature labyrinth and colorful recycled glass mosaic shade structure.

2019 - Recycling Game and Ethnobotanical System

  • Designer: Self (individual project)
  • Issuer: NPO China PI Cultural Exchange, Community Development Projects (CDP), Shanghai, China
  • Date: June 2019
  • Overview: Developed a tiered ethnobotanical system and recycling game to make recycling fun for children based on the needs of the community to recycle trash and their lack of funds. Utilizing recycled materials and a recycling station, created a place to play and grow ethnobotanical plants.

2019 - Guang Community Center Green Veranda

  • Designer: Self (individual project)
  • Issuer: NPO China PI Cultural Exchange, CDP, Shanghai, China
  • Date: July 2019
  • Overview: Designed a simple aquaponics unit for the community center where people could gather food as well as enjoy the live fish.

2020 - Green Kamiyama Maker Space Aquaponics System

  • Designer: Self
  • Issuer: Kamiyama Village, Tokushima, 2020
  • Overview: Designed aquaponics system for community revitalization using rainwater capture, native ethnobotanical plants and endangered fisheries, and agricultural plants in the indoor system. Presentation of design operation aired online for Tokushima and Osaka residents and stakeholders.

GENERAL SKILLS

Bilingual and biliterate (English/Spanish), intermediate (JLPT N3) written Japanese Language, advanced spoken Japanese Language, translation and interpretation. Project management, system analysis and problem-solving, spatial analysis and problem-solving, teamwork, teaching, mentorship and leadership, customer service, public relations, creative theory, and seminar speaking.

TECHNICAL SKILLS

General

Design drafting and plan visualization, descriptive technical writing, plant identification, botanical illustration

Software

General office and team use, conducting surveys, SPSS, R programming for statistical computing and data visualization and analysis, qualitative research, mixed methods, ArcGIS, project management environment, website development, Google Education environment, Blackmagic video editing, Adobe Creative Suite and other illustration and drawing software for design and architecture, photogrammetry, LIDAR, AutoCAD, Rhino.

Hardware

Desktop computer assembly and troubleshooting, soldering and electronic parts replacement, and some electrical circuit troubleshooting and repair.

RESEARCH SKILLS

Complex system analysis and problem-solving, planning, team design, teaching, community workshop facilitation, interviews, questionnaire surveys, design, botanical documentation, mapping, environmental education, report-writing, form design, planning of landscapes and social-environmental systems on large and small scales.

ART & DESIGN SKILLS

Landscape Architecture

Spatial analysis and interdisciplinary problem-solving, empathetic/biophilic/universal design, conceptualization, hand sketches and drafting, scale modeling, model photography, universal design, and ethnobotany.

Fine Art

Fine art (pottery, watercolor, mixed media - from higher education/apprenticeship training); Japanese Sumi-E charcoal watercolor (3-year study, Japan). Bitwig and other music software.

Other Skills

Adobe Creative Suite and other illustration and drawing software; photography; acrylics, pastels, watercolors, and oils; clay and stone working. 3D design software.

INTERESTS

Fine art, birds, mushrooms, cybernetics, green architecture, Ethnobotany, traditional medical systems, languages, social-ecological systems, naturalist philosophy, philosophy, poetry, yoga, dance, singing, building computers, and metal detecting.
